website_summaries.verdict: Reasonably priced for an interchangeable-lens model, with the same high-quality photos of its siblings, the E-PL1 nevertheless suffers from slow performance that makes it a poor choice for snapshooters looking to upgrade.
pros: can shoot raw+JPEG in every mode, including Art Filters and iAuto

customer_reviews.title: Great time to get into M4/3rd with this camera
customer_reviews.text: Until recently, I always thought of myself as a Nikon/Canon DSLR kind of guy. But after reevaluating my photographic priorities, I rolled the dice and went EPL1. This is one fun camera. Amazing Jpegs--forget RAW (embarrassed to admit it), the jpegs on this are so beautiful--no need to post process. And the art filters are so much fun (slowness is there, but still usable). My old manual film lenses have new life with this camera. I find i reach for this more than my trusty D90. Don't want to go on and on here. In summary this is art in a box. And at $280, this is a steal.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Small camera, great images
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera looking for one that was smaller and more portable than a DSLR but was also capable of great images. Pros: The image quality is great. Does well in low light. Small and easy to handle. Intuitive operations. Nice built-in flash for snapshots. Cons: A bit slow to save images to disk. Doesn't seem to do as well with action shots. No viewfinder (but I knew that when I bought it. I will probably add the VF3 viewfinder accessory. I have also purchased the Fotodiox adapter that allows use of SLR manual lenses with this body. Summary: Great quality, good camera for family photos, sightseeing, etc.
customer_reviews.author: The Bear

customer_reviews.title: my digital back
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Olympus Pen e-PL1 camera chiefly for the availability of the adapter to my Minolta Lens. Using Minolta glass and aperture priority mode, I have essentially a digital back for my superior Minolta lens. With the built-in stabiliser, photographs taken with my 5oomm mirror lens (on this camera that translates to 1000mm in four/thirds format) are brilliantly clear. The added advantage of a wider range of f stops (50mm f1.4 - f16) makes a difference in low light photography. Coupled with a class 10 16Gig memory card and shooting in RAW, I have an awesome combination.
customer_reviews.author: Nowhere Man

customer_reviews.title: good compromise solution
customer_reviews.text: Just got it and early results are promising. Good replacement for lower end SLR's, Olympus sensors have always given me good colors and sharpness, this is no exception. Size is good, not overly featured but really hits the mark for what it is trying to do. This is a good replacement for travel for my Nikon D40- focus not as fast but good focus, nonetheless. Flash is adequate for travel camera, good size and feel. Always liked the Olympus menu system, this reminds me of my early Olympus camera's. I have bought a bunch of cameras in the past few years, would characterize this as a good travel camera, SLR like and good electronics. Good job Oly!
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Gauthier

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but a bit out-dated
customer_reviews.text: Replacement for my underwater rig. Camera takes decent photos, and I'm sticking with it, for now. However, focus is a bit slow, and the newer versions of this camera, along with most everything else in its class with newer technology, is better. If you are on a tight budget, it will surely give you nice photos, but if you want better, you can get it by paying more.
customer_reviews.author: C. Scott

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy that I picked this brand
customer_reviews.text: As a person who only views photography as an outlet for my creative energy and know nothing beyond what I've learned myself - my opinion is somewhat lacking credit...but, I can attest for the quality of the resolution and color of the photos I've taken with this camera. It's fairly priced and for someone who doesn't need a $2,000 camera it fits my needs and beyond. I adore the settings on this camera. They are clear and informative if needed, and give me options to play with. I'm very happy that I picked this brand.
customer_reviews.author: annibells.

customer_reviews.title: Great value in a midlevel camera
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an aging, battered digital Rebel with this camera, and could not be more pleased. Great images, reasonably good video. Fast for multiple shots, as high as 3200 ISO lets me shoot indoors without flash even with the kit lens. The kit lens is nothing spectacular, but does the job for a good all-around workhorse. The camera has proven to be durable. My only complaint is that the user interface required me to open the manual to figure out how to set ISO.. but that was it. :-) I would absolutely recommend it as a step up from a pocket camera, for backpacking and hiking, etc.
customer_reviews.author: JBowl0101

customer_reviews.title: Cheap fun to use and easy on my wallet
customer_reviews.text: Nice little camera a baby step up from a basic point and shoot but not a full fledged DSLR. The camera is not great in low light but in all other ways the Olympus PEN E-PL1 12.3MP Live MOS Micro Four Thirds Interchangeable Lens meets my very basic needs. The camera was cheap fun to use and easy on my wallet. I took one star off due to lots of noise in low light. If you are outside or in a brightly lit room this camera is great.
customer_reviews.author: AUTISTIC WEREWOLFTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Camera Heaven
customer_reviews.text: Got this camera about two weeks ago and the more I use it the more I love it. First let me just say that I'm have own Canon, sigmas and full frame Nikon gear. This is an amazing camera, so intuitive, picture quality is just great. The ability to use my Nikon lenses or just about any lenses via adaptor, makes it a joy to use. Keep in mind, there is no perfect camera, but for me this is pretty close. Some of the previous reviews describes this camera as a work of art and I have to agree. This camera is just beautiful. If Olympus keeps making this type cameras, I will keep buying them.
customer_reviews.author: Steelman

customer_reviews.title: Loving it!
customer_reviews.text: So far, I am loving this camera. The colors are awesome, lag time doesn't exist (or, if it does, it is not noticeable AT ALL), video is good, art filters are fun to use. It is not that bulky. I have never owned an SLR camera before, and I now am so happy I haven't ordered one, because this one's size is on the verge of convenient size, when it comes to traveling and taking pictures. The quality of pictures to me looks like SLR quality. I recommend it to everyone who wants to upgrade from point-and-shoot cameras, who wants to learn more about photography, and who wants to use it as a travel camera, as well.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ignjatovic

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera for the price.
customer_reviews.text: After years of owning DSLRs such as the Nikon D200 and Canon Rebel XSI I can honestly say that the IQ of this camera is second to none. High ISO and color production is actually better than my former SLRs. The JPEGs from the EPL-1 are stunning to say the very least and after years of shooting RAW I am glad to spend more time out shooting and less time behind a computer trying to get things right. The menu system is much better than my former EP1 and auto focus is greatly improved to the point where it leaves very little to be desire. Is this camera good enough to replace your SLR with, yes it is.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Watson

customer_reviews.title: Great Image Quality
customer_reviews.text: This camera was bought used and arrived promptly on the very 1st day of the estimate delivery-date-range. Camera with the kit lens are both in excellent conditions. Thought it is comparable in cost, size and weight as my LUMIX super-zoom camera, the picture quality seems better and has more details. It takes decent pictures even in low light after fine-tuning the settings. The adjustment on various settings is very simple with the pointer/button. This camera truly deserves a thorough reading of the instruction manual by the user to find what it is capable of. Its relatively compact size and weight will greatly help many of us serious but non-professional photographers to capture happy memories in great and professional-like pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Fix-it

customer_reviews.title: Old mirrorless camera great for photos not so great for 5 min videos...
customer_reviews.text: Microphone adapter is $60 and out of stock...get a cannon or sony a6600.
customer_reviews.author: frank.atwood

customer_reviews.title: Solid Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid camera that provides a great overall experience. Solid pictures and video. You need to take your time with the camera. The auto-focus setting is not for all occasions. But it has more than enough settings for the advance photographer to use and get the required picture. The auto-focus is a little slow but the manual focusing is great. Not a professional grade camera but it is more than enough for myself(advanced user). If you are a pro get something else, and if you just need a point and shoot this is not for you.
customer_reviews.author: Cp

customer_reviews.title: Great value for amazing camera
customer_reviews.text: I like taking photographs a lot, but haven't really spend on a good camera, like SLR. When this format of Micro 4/3 appear, i was really interested and it has been a great discovery so far. The camera let's you take so much better photographs than a point and shoot, and the size, weight and layout of the buttons gives you every control you need. The best part it's the capacity to and accesories, the kit lens its not very versatile, so i'm looking to buy another with more zoom. But takes great quality pictures. Also you can add a more powerful Flash or a ViewFinder that looks awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Diego De la Cruz Bornholdt

customer_reviews.title: After years of use still love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I've had this camera for over 5 years and love it very much still to this day, I've used it for simple kids photos to recording my kids during sporting events. Great camera easy to use yet powerful enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: dj

customer_reviews.title: Now an Olympus fan lol
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great and amazing and is such a great product. the art feature is soooo much fun to use it brings colors to a new level. This camera did at first take forever to save files but that is when you use the art feature. the HD is great it's very sturdy and durable. The interchangeable lens is out of this world as a film student it does offer some amazing capabilities and I love this camera I used to hate the brand but this is their future and hopefully it only gets better and better lol.
customer_reviews.author: MiahJ

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I'm a point and shoot kind of girl, but my teen girls like what this camera can do. The 16-year-old took a few kids' senior pictures with it. They turned out wonderfully. I, however, still struggle. There are times when I have it in automatic mode and I take videos instead of pictures. No one in my family can figure out how/why I can do that, but it happens about 1/2 the time I take pictures. Definitely worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Im in love with this camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for a trip that I was taking to Alaska. It shot incredible photos and was small enough to take everywhere. I have been using it now for about 6 months, and I still love it. It has a ton of features which make for some very creative photos, and it is easy enough for anyone to use like a normal camera, and has practically the same capabilities as a full sized DSL that cost twice as much. If you want to get into photograph beyond a point and shoot. This is the camera to have. You will love it.
customer_reviews.author: eric ravnikar

customer_reviews.title: One Tiny Beef
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera, and got a great deal on Amazon since a newer model was introduced. The only issue I have is the outdated charger with its unnecessary cord. A charger with flip pins would have been a perfect match for this compact camera. I am getting increasingly annoyed at this oversight the more I travel with multitudes of cords and chargers!
customer_reviews.author: Nick D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera less than a month before going to Alaska. I may never learn to use all the functions but I came home with some great pictures. The software ("ib") that comes from Olympus with the camera is not my favorite but it is usable. I will find something better when I have time. The only negative is that the accessories are expensive; I will do without for now even though I have several OM SLR lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Carry Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera for carrying when you don't want to carry a DSLR. The picture quality is much better than a point and shoot and so close to a DSLR that I can't tell the difference. The controls are okay so long as you are willing to go through the menus. For what I wanted a super point and shoot this works for me. The autofocus is not as fast as a DSLR but okay for snap shots and vacation pictures. If you want to do sports take along a DSLR. I also have the 40 to 150mm lens. It works great if the light is good. That is what I expected given the f-stop settings.
customer_reviews.author: JRD

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: this camera was recommended to me as a started camera for my niece. She is now delving in to the world of photography, loving all of the different features this camera has! It takes amazing shots!!! Comparable to some I have taken with my Nikon, which costed far more! great camera for new photographers!
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Davis

customer_reviews.title: Fun little camera
customer_reviews.text: I have a variety of DSLRs and point and shoot cameras. This one fits nicely in the middle, it isn't as bulky as my DSLRs (which can get heavy if out sightseeing an entire day) but gives me more control than say a basic P/S camera. I have been pleased with the image quality and can say that it meets if not slightly exceeds the image quality of the larger sensored Samsung NX100 & NX10 (which I also own and also enjoy).
customer_reviews.author: Michael K. Scherzer

customer_reviews.title: Happy photo bug....
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! Wish it came with a slightly larger zoom lens but will have to do for now. The difference in the pictures (this vs. reg.digital) are clear immediately. I especially love the fact that I have the ability to let it auto decide settings or do a manual takeover :) Gives me plenty of room to learn the slr features while allowing me the ability to take those need now pics. Only downside I saw, like I said before, the zoom lens that comes with the camera (14-42mm) just won't cut it for more than a good landscape or portrait.
customer_reviews.author: Shan

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from P&S camera
customer_reviews.text: If you are the one 1. who does not want to carry heavy and bulky DSLR camera but you want a DSLR-like photo quality 2. who is a budget-minded buyer like me always looking for a value for money product 3. who wants to start learning photography without investing so much on pricey cameras then, Olympus E-PL 1 is definitely for you. I am very satisfied with this camera so far. There are some downsides like slow auto focus, button control for aperture and shutter speed, etc, but I can live with that. Do not be confused by its low price tag. It is really a great camera. (This camera came with an international warranty)
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: love this thing
customer_reviews.text: love this thing! takes amazing pics. love all of the settings. our safari pics look like national geographic. wish it came with a great zoom lense though or at least that the lenses weren't so pricey.
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: Combining a large sensor diagonal , lots of pixels and an easy to use interface , coupled with the excellent micro four/thirds optics this gives as good an image as expense DSLR's without all the bulk. i bought this one as a spare. i have a second identical E-PL1 in an inderwater houseing for taking pictures while scuba diving.
customer_reviews.author: vincent himpe

customer_reviews.title: E-PL1 a hit
customer_reviews.text: I love the E-PL1 from Olympus. As a former owner of a Mamiya 6mf who swore that he would never move to digital, I have been converted. I am still learning the camera but it has wonderful features and is both easy to use and very complex. There are a myriad of options in the custom menu that allow for a ton of flexability. The single button record for HD video is wonderful, although you have to be careful to shut of the camera when you put it away in the bag least you hit the record button by mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Franken

customer_reviews.title: Little camera, great options
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera as a Fathers Day gift. What a great product. I had 4 lenses from Topcon cameras I own. With a cheap adaptor I am able to use all of them. You get all the capability of a point and shoot(only a little bigger) with all the power of a DSLR. Highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: E Karr

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: This little number takes some great pictures. If you expect this to be a point & shoot, it is not. You need to take the time to read the manual and watch or read some photog tutorials about it. Get comfortable with the settings. Once you do all that your pics will be amazing. If you don't want to take the time, stick to a point & shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Xty

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I have had it stolen and replaced it with the same model, as it suits my needs perfectly. The vintage look is nice as well.
customer_reviews.author: adi

customer_reviews.title: Great bridge camera, photo quality and build construction for the price
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice little camera with a lot of potential in the right hands. I adore it because im learning almost everything i need to know about digital photography. To take great pictures you need to start learning the basics, exposure, aperture, shutter speed, focal lenght and so on. This camera is great for learning and playing with manual controls, and it'll let you take awesome professional like pictures as long as you apply the right technics. Because of these i consider it an awesome bridge camera, but trust me if you're going to stick to the iAuto mode you dont need this. Simply you wont be using all the potential this camera has to offer.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique

customer_reviews.title: too many menus
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the photos is very good. But there are two buts: too many menu driven options and not enough external controls. It simply takes too long to make changes. I also feel the optional $200+ electronic view finder is essential if you plan on taking pictures outdoors in the day time. The screen washes out in sunlight, leaving you hoping and wishing that you get the shot you wanted.
customer_reviews.author: ArtW

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera
customer_reviews.text: It is an awesome camera with a DSLR working style OLYMPUS rendered. Its pictures are superb, and detail within this price range. The camera's metering is very dependable, in most of the circumstances for me. The excellent JEPG and RAW compatibility files in-camera, means many good qualities. Overall, the users in this price range get the most of DSLR attributes with excellent image quality.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: good camera, works as well as entry dslrs, maybe better? not very complicated, which I like. I'd check around for more comprehensive tech reviews but I like it and it takes great pictures.
customer_reviews.author: vuhx

customer_reviews.title: Good camera for the price
customer_reviews.text: We got this camera to replace our P+S, and it's really good for that. It's not a DSLR, but we weren't expecting it to be. I'm happy for the price. I have a problem focusing sometimes, but that could just be me not knowing the correct setting to put it on.
customer_reviews.author: William Melcher

customer_reviews.title: Olympus PEN E-PL1
customer_reviews.text: I would like a remote shutter release and a eye level viewfinder. There is an accessory for the latter, but not the former. The camera takes great photos and allows me to use some of my old Pentax K mount lenses, I give it an eight out of ten.
customer_reviews.author: boz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mirrorless camera
customer_reviews.text: This Olympus is great. I bought it, a couple of batteries and a flash card. Since then, I have added a 40-150mm lens. It takes wonderful pictures. The only con is that the LCD monitor is hard to see in bright light but that is for all cameras without the viewfinder. Probably will eventually buy the VF-2 viewfinder.
customer_reviews.author: M. L. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this camera for my son's birthday. He is completely happy with it. We did a lot of research prior to selecting this product, and so far, it is living up to all the positive reviews we read. The camera is user-friendly and he has posted some amazing pictures already.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Awesome camera (with one problem)
customer_reviews.text: The reason why I got this camera was because this seller was selling it at a reasonable price. The retail price at the official Olympus site is around $600... Which I think is a exorbitant. The shipping was good, made it in time considering the fact that it wasn't a prime-eligible item. I like everything about this camera, from the size to the design and the function. The only problem I have, however, is that the auto-focus is too slow. Takes awhile for it to adjust at certain points. But overall, awesome camera if you don't want to spend two-three hundred more on a DSLR. Cute design too.
customer_reviews.author: JKim

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I want to buy a camera with high quality, the DSLR is to heavy for me. I first planed to buy sony NEX-5N, but the price is about 2 times more than E-PL1, however, the picture qualities are not 2 times better than that of E-PL1. So, I bought this one. It's a little bit heavy.
customer_reviews.author: LUNGX

customer_reviews.title: I love this item
customer_reviews.text: as a handy camera ,it is good one. Just light weight and small and easy handling...also pictures are very good quality.But only the multi-shooting speed is not so fast as expected
customer_reviews.author: SEUNGWHAN BAIK

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I like the camera. Don't get me wrong, it's not a DSLR. It can take some good pictures, but it can take bad ones too. If you're trying to get the best shot the first time, you may want to stick with a point and shoot, of course this is all coming from somebody who tosses that cheap lens that came with this camera aside after I got one of the antique ones that works with this camera. If you're trying to get into photography and aren't rich, the refurb edition of one runs about the same as a good point and shoot. Just make sure you're ready to spend some money on ebay for OM series lens.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Hotchkiss

customer_reviews.title: But it's still shoots amazing photos and is light
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for more than 4 years now. Some parts are now starting to fall off after months of backacpking. But it's still shoots amazing photos and is light.
customer_reviews.author: jl

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. Pretty good picture quality. Very portable. Takes multiple lenses which is a big plus. Wish I could get the attachable viewfinder at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Charles C. Greene

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have had the camera for about a month and it works perfect for me. Smaller and easier than the full size digital, but still lots of options and features that let you be creative. Able to set all auto so that I can pass the camera to someone to take our picture with one-touch. The built in flash is great. I am very glad I got an extra backup battery. Next step is to get a wide angle lens attachment?!?
customer_reviews.author: A Kloster

customer_reviews.title: Olympus pen pl-1 camera
customer_reviews.text: Best buy for the money. Fairly simple to use, excellent quality and build. Shot my first photos at the state fair using the art filters. Wow what great results. Can't wait to use with the 40-150mm lens.
customer_reviews.author: Keith H. Wooten

customer_reviews.title: I'll tell you why I love it...
customer_reviews.text: this camera is very useful with it's compact size and affordability. The images are great; crisp and clean and the look is it is fantastic. I have gotten so many compliments already and I've only had it for a week or something like that... I recommend it. It's beautiful and it is good.
customer_reviews.author: Susy V

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera For The Price
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift a family memeber wanted badly. The camera has performed well. He is very pleased with it. The price was right compared to what I've seen it elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: RJS

customer_reviews.title: good choice
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! After several point and shoots that quit or declined in quality after a year or two, I was ready for something more dependable. I am by no means an experienced photographer, so I didn't think I was ready for a full-fledged DSLR. Thank goodness I settled on this darling. There are plenty of settings and photo options to keep me busy, and with all the selections, it is almost impossible to take a bad photo. Needless to say, that after 5 years of bad cameras and 2 years with no camera at all, I feel like I couldn't have wound up with a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Mbaj

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR TRAVEL
customer_reviews.text: if you going to travel, and walk a lot, this is the one to look for 1) takes great pictures, as good as DSLR 2) you can walk all day with it, not heavy or bulky 3) size is perfect, will not get any attention from other people overall its Better than i expected,
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: First review I've written
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting a new camera for awhile and my wife and I have been looking at DSLRs but have been hesitant as we have no idea how to use all the features/settings of a DSLR. After speaking with friends who have a PEN-1, we went ahead and purchased this camera and are extremely pleased with it. The pictures are amazing. Very easy to use. Feels sturdy in your hands. The video camera is also wonderful, and has replaced our dedicated HD video camera (what's the point anymore of having one?) Would I purchase this camera again? YES!
customer_reviews.author: MacFan

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase experience
customer_reviews.text: This camera came with everything you would expect and pretty generous at that. Arrived promptly too.
customer_reviews.author: bookworm52

customer_reviews.title: Good picture quality
customer_reviews.text: Durable (my 2 years old always playing with it). Good picture quality, easy to use. Just need to buy better lens
customer_reviews.author: Efficient

customer_reviews.title: SLR quality for cheap point and shoot price
customer_reviews.text: The lens feels very cheap, but realy... for the price it will be impossible to get anything better with this picture quality. I've taken fantastic professional looking pictures! A bit hard to get used to in the begining, but worth every penny! I highly recommend this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Andre Portilho Maciel

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: wonderful camera I love olympus camera's this a great product for out door photos it is great for non photographer's a little hard to understand the digital working. good seller.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: amazing camera!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing camera! I am in love with it! It takes such clear pictures both indoors and outdoors. Works very well in both regular lighting and low-light WITHOUT flash. I've tried this out on nature, food, models, and events & received lots of compliments. So far I've only played with the auto settings. I can't wait to shoot manual, I'm sure it'll be even better!
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha G.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: I GAVE THIS CAMERA TO MY NIECE AS A GIFT. GOOD ONE AND RIGHT PRICING. IT HAS NICE COLOT TOO.
customer_reviews.author: Sampaguita

customer_reviews.title: Camera takes great pics, with effort
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a bit bigger and heavier than I imagined. It's not easily portable as the pic is deceiving. The lens it comes with sticks out over an inch and does not have zoom capabilities (for shooting things in the distance and zooming in on them to appear closer). You need another lens for that apparently. (need to price those now.) There are settings you can change up to create effects, and a manual setting for point and shoot. It's a quality camera that takes some familiarization. The results are awesome though and worth the time.
customer_reviews.author: R. M-C

customer_reviews.title: great Cam
customer_reviews.text: great cam , fast shipping. after reading reviews and watching reviews i decided to get this great cam for a reasonable price. hope i will improve my skills with this professional one.
customer_reviews.author: TAROOB BOULOS

customer_reviews.title: Olympus PEN EPL1
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. I was a noob when it came to film and high quality digital photography so this camera has really helped me get started. I am still learning, but I feel much more confident since I have been using this. The image quality is superb at 12.3 megapixels. You have so many effects and lighting options to choose from. I love being able to take it wherever and make a high quality short film as well. :)
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: This really deserves more than 5 stars.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my sister graduation gift. I'm very pleased with this model, especially since it's user friendly and dumb proof. Wish the waterproof case wasn't just as much as the camera.
customer_reviews.author: RubyRed

customer_reviews.title: Camera review
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my daughter it was a Christmas gift. She absolutely loves it . I purchased the same product a couple of years ago for my girlfriend and she loves hers.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Sbrizza

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend I have been looking for a camera for a few months and saw the great reviews and the great price and do not regret jumping on it! The camera takes amazing photos and has a lot of different settings and even tips for your photo subject. If you are looking for a camera with a large zoom though dont get this. Its for shorter range photos but we knew that going it. I highly recommend this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: I'm an amateur to photography
customer_reviews.text: Photography? Not exactly my forté. But hey! I like to take pictures now & then so I've been strolling around the internet for a good, well built, high quality picture taking camera for quite some time now. Well folks, this is it. Not only does this camera take amazing pictures, it's so simple to use. It is a great compact size, and is light weight. It also has these cool art filters that you can use to make things a little more interesting. Bottom line, I love this camera so far. You just can't beat the price. So if you want to play photographer for the day & be successful at it, consider this camera your new pal.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Greatest camera ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest camera I have ever used. I used it in school and when I graduated I knew I had to buy one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: Cyan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Takes good pictures with adequate light. RAW format is pretty sweet. Included photos were taken with mine.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Smith

customer_reviews.title: good camera
customer_reviews.text: The Olympus E-PL1 is better than what I expected in low light performance. I compare with my Panasonic LX-3 for the night shots, PL1 out performs the LX-3. The larger image sensor in Olympus gave PL1 edge over other P&S camera. The only negative is the size of the PL1, it's not pocketable.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chang

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera
customer_reviews.text: Every picture is beautiful. No problems at all. I don't miss not having a viewfinder. I have had the camera for a year and still love it.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Jackson

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: i bought this form my friend the price was good and he feels happy with his camera for mi is ok
customer_reviews.author: Pacificard

customer_reviews.title: great camera!
customer_reviews.text: olympus pen e-pl1 is my favorite EVIL camera. it great on low light, nice image quality with low price :) i bouht it three times.
customer_reviews.author: risna

customer_reviews.title: I loved it
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera, the design is awesome, the quality is great! it's small. I love tha the lens is manual. Definitely one of my favourites, it arrived on time and in good shape.
customer_reviews.author: Talina

customer_reviews.title: Good camera, but I prefer something smaller for travel.
customer_reviews.text: The camera works great. I only have the one lens and it isn't enough zoom for me. Too bulky for me to carry around. I found it much harder to use than my Panasonic Lumix travel camera and I really didn't see any improvement in pictures over the Panasonic. I have stopped using this camera.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: My experience was excellent! I love this camera it's great for beginners and pros! Has alot of features that are easy to use. Art mode is great. Lens is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklin

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera for the specific purpose of photographing my original paintings for reproduction. I am not by any means a professional photographer so there has been a learning curve but so far the camera has preformed as well as expected. My purchase was based on the reviews of other owners and suggestions from camera magazine articles.
customer_reviews.author: Rich P

customer_reviews.title: GREAT LITTLE CAMERA.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera after owning an Olympus EP-2 for a year mainly because this one has a built-in pop-up flash. I just wish it focused better at low light levels & I wish it had a built-in viewfinder.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Samuel W. Sisson

customer_reviews.title: PERFECTION
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely Perfect! Nothing wrong with it at all. Super excited to play around with it and show my hubby how to do photography ;)
customer_reviews.author: Serena Speers

customer_reviews.title: Move up from compact camera
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this camera. Still trying to figure out some features but so far I'm a very satisfied costumer. Will buy other lens as soon as I master this camera. Shipping is fast. A+++
customer_reviews.author: Jun

customer_reviews.title: Like this Camera
customer_reviews.text: I'll consider myself a beginner to mid level photographer. I like how this product feels in my hand and some of the preset art pics. It takes good pics, alot to improve at low lights, the battery life is good. I would recommend this to a friend at the price listed.
customer_reviews.author: H Singh

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Great camera with great options. Easy to use for a starter! HD Video is great.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: PEN magic
customer_reviews.text: I am a serious amateur photographer and use a Nikon D700 for digital as well as a Leica M7 and Mamiya 6 for film. I used the E-PL1 at an Olympus sponsored event and shot with it all morning. What a blast! Lots of fun, lightweight and very good pictures. I bought two copies for my daughters and have seen some stellar pics from Peru and Glacier as a result. Although the pictures are not quite as good as those from my higher end equipment, the differences won't matter to most people given the high quality results obtained from a very portable camera costing less than $600.
customer_reviews.author: Jim S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera, great price
customer_reviews.text: Got this for work, needed better quality shots but don't want to lug around a DSLR. Close up shots are INCREDIBLE!!
customer_reviews.author: nate

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised. I got this for my daughter and she is a video and picture taking genius now. Perfect for a high school film entrepeneur.
customer_reviews.author: Stan PBG,FL

customer_reviews.title: Grrreaaattt Camera!
customer_reviews.text: My first dslr. Have not taken it to a proper test drive , took a few pics and love the results.The pics are alive and excellent.I love taking pics and have a professional touch to my photos with my ordinary digital camera. Now with this camera the options are unlimited. Can't wait to take beautiful pics with it.It has so many features that it will take one year to get used to all of them.I love it so far, the size is very comfortable to take around.I highly recommend this camera.
customer_reviews.author: RB Solutions

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with the camera
customer_reviews.text: I have had the camera for about a month now and it is working wonderfully. The images it takes are great.It is easy to use. I would recommend this camera for those who are looking for something with more features than a point and shoot, but not as complicated as an SLR.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Vacation saved
customer_reviews.text: i have been extremely pleased with camera. This is the third Olympus brand that I now own, and the first Olympus digital, I very pleased with the image quality, and the quick service in delivery while on vacation after mechanical and operation ending issues with the digitalI had with me on the trip. Definitely recommend!!!!
customer_reviews.author: SM Anderson

customer_reviews.title: No a bad camera
customer_reviews.text: Not so great in low light . Also the camera is a little heavy for its size . Overall the camera is ok. I was influenced by the commercial
customer_reviews.author: Fitz

customer_reviews.title: Love the look, Love Olympus
customer_reviews.text: I must say I like the look of this camera much better than the E-PM1 and it takes good photos in bright and sunlight. Dark shots are full of noise and the focus is a pain in low light, this could be corrected with a better lens. One thing the lens came dirty but it was just on the outside and the box was in awful condition but it works fine and considering the bad hurricane it came very fast. Considering this next time I might just go to Best Buy!
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: perfect pen
customer_reviews.text: It is evereything I hoped for - light, beautiful, not the heavy black of so many other cameras. Great sharp pics. No problem with zoom as suggested in review. Only problem is that electric viewfinder still not available in US,had to order from Japann.
customer_reviews.author: Madam Mekong

customer_reviews.title: Christmas present to myself
customer_reviews.text: Pictures are super sharp. Haven't shot any videos but the ones on youtube look great. . . . . .
customer_reviews.author: K. Wade

customer_reviews.title: Olympus PEN E-PL1
customer_reviews.text: This digital camera is very well worth the money. What I love is that it's not too heavy to carry around your neck, yet the pictures are sharp and clear, the zoom is easy to use, and it's more like a point and shoot than some of the others I looked at.
customer_reviews.author: Norma

customer_reviews.title: Stunning images, but slow camera
customer_reviews.text: Takes beautiful images, but the only downside is that between images the camera can be slow. On auto settings this is due to its autofocus feature, but otherwise the camera does lag a bit from the speeds I've come to expect from small point-and-shoot Nikons and Canons. Portability loses a star because the lens cap is nearly impossible to get back on, and I feel like I'm damaging the lens motor every time I try.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: beautiful camera
customer_reviews.text: this camera is so cool! its not expensive! if u compare it with other cameras of the same kind! this one is 3 times cheaper and cooler!!! love it
customer_reviews.author: shantajh

customer_reviews.title: Very Reliable Company
customer_reviews.text: Very fast service, Everything was packed professional. The item look brand new and worked perfectly. I really like the fast return on the mailing process.
customer_reviews.author: Nikiska Blair

customer_reviews.title: Smart Little Interchangeable Lenz Camera
customer_reviews.text: It is inexpensive, but smart camera. I believe we can take decent pictures with this camera in bright sunlight. Yes, there is some problem when we use this camera in dim illumination. But I had same experience with DSLR at night.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Y. Choi

customer_reviews.title: Best camera I have ever owned!!
customer_reviews.text: This camera continues to amaze me each and every time I use it. Bar none, the best camera I have ever owned!!
customer_reviews.author: Greeny

customer_reviews.title: like
customer_reviews.text: takes good pictures. i did not get a lens cover is that a separate order? i really dont have anything else to say thank you

customer_reviews.title: A Big Dissapointment !!!
customer_reviews.text: Wanted this camera really bad and waited a year for the price to go down .. It's a BIG DISAPPOINTMENT .. The Camer is SUPER SLOW and the Video quality which they claim to be Professional quality "IS Not" I Hardly ever use this camera as its Performance is HORRBLE ! Wish I Never WASTED my Money on it. I'm sorry to say.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great entry level DSLR with superb image quality.
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera. Since I bought one month ago, I took over a thousand pictures. The image is superb. Easy to use and light compared to other DSLRs to carry wherever you go. Very enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: MusiK

product_meta.title: Olympus PEN E-PL1 12.3MP Live MOS Micro Four Thirds Mirrorless Digital Camera with 14-42mm f/3.5-5.6 Zuiko Digital Zoom Lens (Champagne Silver)
product_meta.description:
Color:Champagne SilverOLYMPUS 262851 12.3 Megapixel E-PL1 Pen Camera (Gold with M. Zuiko 14-42mm lens)

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


The new Olympus PEN E-PL1 is truly greater than the sum of its parts, with a surprisingly small camera body packed with technology normally found in bigger, bulkier and heavier professional Digital Single Lens Reflex (DSLR) cameras and High-Definition (HD) camcorders. This third-generation PEN is built for shutterbugs who always wanted better pictures and considered a DSLR, but were intimidated by the bulky size and complex interface. The new camera's simple design and easy interface enable photographers to easily create amazing images never dreamt possible. 

The E-PL1 equals an affordable and powerfully simple all-in-one package that travels with you to capture life in the high quality that your memories deserve. 



Easily Pen Your Story with a Brand-New PEN 

This third generation of the Olympus PEN series combines powerful features in an easy-to-use package that will make capturing your life more fun. The new direct record button makes taking videos easier than ever and the new Live Guide functionality makes it simple to learn photography techniques without requiring the skills of a pro shooter. 

New Direct Button for HD Movies
Recording HD movies with the E-PL1 is simple, thanks to an easy-to-reach red "direct button" (red record button) on the back of the camera body. If you're about to snap a photo and you realize a video would capture the spirit of the scene even better, simply press the record button and instantly you're capturing videos! Easily toggle back and forth between capturing stills and videos by using your index finger to press the shutter button or your thumb to press the red record button. Having the ability to shoot still images and videos opens up a world of imaging possibilities. 

New Live Guide Sets the Scene Before You Shoot
The E-PL1's new Live Guide interface simplifies great photography and gets the results you desire at the touch of a button. Want more vivid or muted color in your shot? Want warmer or cooler color? Want a brighter or darker subject, or a sharper or softer background? Or maybe you want to capture the fast-moving action of your subject with a little artistic blur, or perhaps freeze the action? Simply select Live Guide and press the up and down arrows on the back of the camera to slide through numerous photographic effects. Make adjustments and watch the LCD as the effects are made live before the image is captured! Don't worry about learning technical things like f-stops, shutter speed and white balance; jump right in by composing, adjusting exposure and more before the shot is taken. 

Seeing the results before snapping the image ensures you are getting the shots you want, and it will change the way you photograph. Shooting Tips are also included with Live Guide, so you can leave the manual at home. 

Automate Everything
Live Guide is just the start of automated technologies on the E-PL1 designed to free you up to focus on your subjects instead of focusing on your camera's settings.  * 19 Scene-Select Modes: From portraits to sunset shots, the E-PL1 is equipped with 19 Scene-Select modes for effortless picture taking, including Fireworks, Sunset, Children, Macro and Panorama, to name a few. Capturing beautiful portraits is easy with the ePortrait Mode that enables you to smooth your subject's complexion. 
 * Intelligent Auto (iAuto) Mode: When you don't want to use the scene-select modes, the iAuto mode automatically identifies what you're shooting and adjusts settings for you to capture the best result depending on the situation. 
 * Face Detection: Reduce the chance of blurred subjects in images by recognizing up to eight faces, tracking them within the image area, and automatically focusing and optimizing exposure for sharp portraits. 
 * In-Camera Panorama: Capture three images and stitch them together to create one amazing, seamless panoramic picture. Or use the included OLYMPUS [ib] software to stitch up to 10 images together for the ultimate panorama. 
 * iEnhance: With this mode the warm yellow and orange colors of a sunset are heightened to a dramatically lifelike color that's truer to what you see with the naked eye. iEnhance can be used in any mode, and automatically engages when using iAuto to enrich color in any subject. 
 * Share: Just connect the camera to an HDTV with an optional HDMI cable and use your TV remote to control playback functions and navigate the camera's menus from the comfort of your personal front-row seat. The E-PL1 records to SDHC (Class 6 recommended) media cards that can be plugged directly into many devices and accommodate large files, including videos. 

New Powerfully Simple Pop-Up Flash
The E-PL1 is the first camera in the Olympus PEN series with a built-in pop-up flash that makes it easy to illuminate low-light subjects, reduce red-eye and fill in dark areas. The camera is also compatible with a range of optional external flashes, including the Olympus FL-36R and FL-50R, which can be controlled wirelessly by the E-PL1 so you can dynamically control lighting as your photography skills grow. 

Pro-Quality Images 

How do professional photographers capture the stunning images you see in the pages of glossy magazines and coffee-table books? Talent matters, of course, but you also need the right equipment. Rest assured that the E-PL1 has everything you need to produce vibrant, professional-quality images: a large image sensor, in-body Image Stabilization, Imager Autofocus, the proven Olympus Dust Reduction System and the TruePic V Image Processor. 



Big Sensor, Not a Big Body
At the heart of the E-PL1 is a large-size image sensor that's the same sensor as the one inside the Olympus E-30 and E-620 DSLR models. The only difference between this sensor and what the pros use is that this big sensor is inside the much smaller body of the E-PL1. This high-performance 12.3-megapixel Live MOS image sensor (eight times larger than the average point-and-shoot camera sensor) delivers excellent dynamic range, accurate color fidelity, and a state-of-the-art amplifier circuit to reduce noise and capture fine image details in both highlight and shadow areas. 

Stabilize All of Your Lenses
Instead of selling more expensive lenses that have image stabilization inside them, Olympus takes a different approach by having image stabilization built right into the body of the E-PL1. This means that any lens (Micro Four Thirds, Four Thirds and any third-party lens) attached to the E-PL1 will deliver blur-free images thanks to three modes of In-body Image Stabilization that automatically compensate for camera shake, including in low-light situations or when shooting without a tripod. Since the PEN cameras are the world's smallest interchangeable-lens cameras with image stabilization built inside the body, you can take the E-PL1 with you and capture great images, and it won't weigh you down. 

Track Your Subjects Wherever They Roam
The E-PL1's Continuous Autofocus (C-AF) Tracking and Autofocus (AF) Target Registration locks your subject into focus and constantly adjusts focus and brightness whether you or your subject is moving. With this mode, a simple push of the shutter release enables you to keep moving subjects in focus--tracking them from left to right and from front to back--within the frame, automatically ensuring that even active subjects, like kids playing sports, are captured clearly. 

The E-PL1's Imager Autofocus in Live View enables you to compose, focus and capture the shot quickly and easily without ever taking your eyes off the camera's large, 2.7-inch full-color, high-contrast HyperCrystal LCD for an easy, seamless viewing experience when shooting still images or videos. The LCD also provides a wide viewing angle of 176 degrees, which ensures that images can be composed from even the most obscure angles. 

This Camera Leaves Others in the Dust
If you're just starting out with a camera that has interchangeable lenses, you don't have to worry about dust spots on your sensor ruining the perfect image every time you change lenses. Spend more time shooting with the E-PL1 and less time worrying about dust with the proven Olympus Dust Reduction System that produces spot-free photos with the exclusive Supersonic Wave Filter, a patented ultrasonic technology that vibrates to remove dust and other particles from the front of the image sensor, capturing them on a special adhesive membrane every time the camera is turned on. 

True-to-Life Color
The E-PL1's Live MOS image sensor is complemented by Olympus' TruePic V Image Processor, which produces clear and colorful photos using all the pixel information for each image to provide the best digital images possible. The image processor is noted for accurate natural color, true-to-life flesh tones, brilliant blue skies and precise tonal expression; it also lowers image noise in photos shot at higher ISO settings (ISO 100 to ISO 3200), enabling great results in low-light situations. 

Easily Expand Your Creative Horizons With Built-in Effects 

Express yourself with in-camera creative features. Professional images are rarely unedited images. Video and still image pros use computer-editing software to render their images with effects that set their shots apart from the pack. Olympus appreciates that you may not have hours to spend retouching your images at the computer, so the E-PL1 incorporates editing effects inside the camera to save you time. Whether you apply in-camera creative effects while shooting an image, or apply them later to images captured without the effects, all are inside the E-PL1, so you can achieve dramatic results on the go without a computer or editing software. 

The E-PL1 has six in-camera Art Filters, including a new filter called Gentle Sepia. This filter gives your images and videos a soft, warm sepia cast similar to historical images from the early days of photography. The sepia tones are softer and the blacks are a true black, unlike traditional sepia images. The new filter joins Pop Art, Soft Focus, Pin Hole, Grainy Film and Diorama (the filter that makes everything look as small as the E-PL1). 

With the E-PL1's Multiple Exposure function available for still image capture, you are free to tell a visual story your way. The image capture options enable you to shoot one shot, then another and combine them in real time, or capture both shots separately and combine them within the camera later. Take a shot of your significant other, and overlay your self-portrait on top to figure out what your kids will look like. If you have kids already, overlay your kid's face on top of a shot of his or her favorite cartoon character for laughs. Your ability to manipulate space and time makes this new creative multimedia device a veritable time machine. 

You often can achieve greater photographic expression by framing a scene in a unique way. The E-PL1 provides four aspect ratios that serve as masks to frame your image to the desired proportions, including the standard 4:3 aspect ratio that is suited to an 8 x 10-inch enlargement; the 16:9 aspect ratio that will display beautifully on a widescreen television; and other popular aspect ratios, such as 3:2 and 6:6. The Multi-Aspect Shooting further expresses your creative vision when combined with in-camera Art Filters and Multiple Exposures. 

With the E-PL1, you have your own living library of still images, HD video and audio to remix at your command. In playback mode, you can seamlessly mix stills and movies inside the camera to create a multimedia slideshow, and dub in one of three built-in dramatic background music options to provide a soundtrack for your cinematic creation. With so many creative options, there's no limit to what you can create. Choose whether or not you want to play back just pictures, just movies or a combination; also control playing back the whole movie or just a clip. 

Open System Easily Grows with Your Ability 

With a basic point-and-shoot camera, you get one lens built into the camera. One lens, that's it. And it's likely a small lens, which doesn't allow a lot of light through to hit the image sensor. So, you may have a difficult time in low-light conditions. And without the option of adding more lenses, you're limited to what that one point-and-shoot lens can do. The E-PL1 solves these issues by accepting a variety of lenses to maximize its functionality. Whether shooting still images or HD video, you can add everything from an extreme wide-angle fisheye lens to a super-telephoto lens for a wide range of expressive options. 

The M. Zuiko Digital Micro Four Thirds lenses are designed to be more compact and portable like the E-PL1. Choose from the ED 14-42mm f3.5/5.6 zoom lens (28-84mm equivalent in 35mm cameras) sold with the E-PL1, the ED 17mm f2.8 lens (34mm equivalent), the new super wide-angle zoom ED 9-18mm f4.0-5.6 lens (18-36mm equivalent) or the high-power wide to telephoto zoom ED 14-150mm f4.0-5.6 lens (28-300mm equivalent). 

If you want to have even more options, the MMF-2 Four Thirds System Lens Adapter makes the E-PL1 compatible with all Olympus Zuiko Digital Specific lenses and other Four Thirds System lenses from Sigma, Panasonic and Leica. Olympus OM film-based lenses can be attached to the E-PL1 with the MF-2 OM Lens Adapter, and there are third-party adapters developed for lenses from most other manufacturers. 

Software & Accessory Options When You're Ready 

The E-PL1 incorporates an accessory port for connecting the optional VF-2 live-finder, a detachable electronic viewfinder, or the new optional SEMA-1 external microphone adapter set (which includes the EMA-1 adapter, the ME-51S stereo microphone and a cord) for those who want to capture enhanced audio with any microphone that has a 3.5mm plug. These optional accessories easily slide into the camera's accessory port and hot shoe. 

Photographers who wish to hold the E-PL1 up to their eye rather than use the LCD will appreciate that the optional VF-2, which provides 1.15x magnification and a 100 percent field of view with sharp resolution, brightness and contrast. The viewfinder refreshes quickly to minimize image ghosting on fast-moving subjects. It also rotates up to 90 degrees to enable photographers to look down into it, which is useful when shooting subjects from challenging angles. The built-in diopter adjustment and high magnification offer easy viewing with and without glasses. 

The E-PL1 offers OLYMPUS [ib] software that includes photography workflow, browsing, editing and unique photo-organizing functions. You can organize your photos by person with automatic face-recognition technology, by location with a Geotagging function or by event. You can easily view photos on an HDTV or on the camera's LCD with the Photo Surfing or Slideshow functions. The name [ib] stands for image bridging, image browsing and image brightening. The software will be available for Windows operating systems only. 

Underwater Housing for Aquatic Adventures
The new camera's compact design makes it the perfect companion for all of your dive trips. The PT-EP01 underwater case has been specially customized for the Olympus E-PL1 and is waterproof to a depth of 40 meters (approximately 130 feet). With its durable, high-quality polycarbonate construction, this Olympus housing protects the camera from water while also cushioning it from knocks and bumps on land. The housing enables viewing from either the camera's LCD screen or an optional electronic viewfinder. The flash connectors allow optional use of up to two UFL-2 underwater flash units via fiber optic cable. A nonremovable front lens port accommodates multiple Micro Four Thirds lenses. 

New Exterior Design, Same PEN DNA
The E-PL1 streamlines the Olympus Micro Four Thirds PEN series form. Thanks to its compact size (4.51" W x 2.84" H x 1.63" D excluding protrusions) and light 10.4-ounce body, the E-PL1 won't weigh you down when you're on the go.
feature_bullets: 12.3-megapixel interchangeable lens digital camera; Micro Four Thirds format
Includes 14-42mm f/3.5-5.6 digital zoom lens; features built-in flash
2.7-inch HyperCrystal LCD with Live View function; Continuous Autofocus (C-AF) tracking system
Capture HD video with high-quality audio; new "Direct Button" for easy recording
Live Guide interface simplifies great photography; capture images to SD/SDHC cards (not included)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars294 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
